title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Le Verseau [Aquarius], from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service, 1824
title_raw: Plate Design:  Le Verseau [Aquarius], from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink over graphite, on support, above image:  Le Verseau [Aquarius]; on support, below image:  la maudité voisine/farre l'eau [the hated neighbor/beware of the water]; in graphite, upper right corner of mount:  1
dimensions:
6.2 x 5.7 cm (2 7/16 x 2 1/4 in. ), image
20.2 x 15 cm (7 3/4 x 6 in.), support
description: A night time scene under a moon lit sky.  A young man, in the foreground, climbs a wall to reach a young girl who peers through a barred window.  An other woman, possibly her mother, leans from an attic window and pours a pitcher of water on the young suiter.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Le Verseau [Aquarius], from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service, 1824. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper. 
1989-13-35.
